examples: Paradoxically, it is this unpower that proceeds to produce the suppressive superpower of metaphysics and that inscribes in Sallis' s work or in his "deconstructive" strategy — I would even say, in his hyperdeconstructive strategy — [...]

verbs.description: unpower (third-person singular simple present unpowers, present participle unpowering, simple past and past participle unpowered)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To remove the power from; power down or power off
examples: “Desperate to retrieve the webscrolls and unpower the staff, which could only be done by tossing it into The Saline Sea, [...]”
